Wed, 12 Jun 2024 17:36:00 +0000 A Waikato punter is $4.5 million richer tonight, striking the Lotto Powerball jackpot just four days after the mammoth $50 million must-be-won draw.

Consent granted for $400m Mount Maunganui retirement village The Pitau https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/consent-granted-for-400m-mount-maunganui-retirement-village-the-pitau/C6GP7WEVJBH75OPS6DUS3GVKEU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/consent-granted-for-400m-mount-maunganui-retirement-village-the-pitau/C6GP7WEVJBH75OPS6DUS3GVKEU/ Megan WilsonCouncil reveals price paid for its former elder housing village site. Consent has since been granted at 'reduced scale'.
Kerikeri quiz champs keen to take on The Chase’s Shaun Wallacehttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/kerikeri-quiz-champs-keen-to-take-on-the-chases-shaun-wallace/EBZ7FTU3Q5FI7A5ZA7FCWNMCIQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/northern-advocate/news/kerikeri-quiz-champs-keen-to-take-on-the-chases-shaun-wallace/EBZ7FTU3Q5FI7A5ZA7FCWNMCIQ/ Mike DinsdaleTop Far North quiz team keen to take on The Chase star Shaun Wallace Wed, 12 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 The champion Kerikeri quiz team Egg Cups at the Rock Salt quiz night. From left, Brett Choat, Paul Barker, Dion Prime, Louise Huett, Carol Barker, Sara Epley and Corine Wils, reckon they could give quizmaster Shaun Wallace, from TV show The Chase, a run for his money when he is in town next month.
Boys’ High sides go down in away fixtures https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/13/boys-high-sides-go-down-in-away-fixtures/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/2024/06/13/boys-high-sides-go-down-in-away-fixtures/ John GilliesLack of a full bench impacted Boys' High football sides playing in Hawke's Bay. Wed, 12 Jun 2024 17:00:00 +0000 Promising midfielder Max Kume (pictured playing for Thistle 2nds in the Geoff Logan Memorial tournament, being chased by Michael Smith) was laid low by travel sickness when Gisborne Boys' High School First XI played Taradale High in a national tournament qualification game last week. Kume came on in the latter stages of the match, but Boys' High could not get the equaliser they were after. Taradale won 1-0. Photo / Paul Rickard
